decks.notes: The key concept of this Izzet Control deck is to maintain control over the game by countering and removing the opponent's threats, while also generating card advantage and value through card draw and recursion. The deck utilizes cards like Essence Scatter, Saw It Coming, Annul, and Disdainful Stroke for counterspells, and removal spells like Spikefield Hazard, Scorching Dragonfire, and Cinderclasm to deal with creatures. It also includes card draw and selection options like Omen of the Sea, Expressive Iteration, and Shark Typhoon to ensure consistency and provide additional win conditions. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value and card advantage in longer games.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent. It makes use of powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Lovestruck Beast, along with versatile spells like Embercleave and Fire Prophecy to control the board and deal massive damage. The goal is to maintain a fast pace of play, applying pressure on the opponent while generating card advantage through cards like Edgewall Innkeeper. The land base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent mana availability for the deck's aggressive game plan.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and mill cards to control the opponent's board and hand. The deck's main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gradually win the game through card advantage and mill. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion highlights the deck's reliance on cheap permanents and the ability to bring them back from the graveyard. The deck aims to stay ahead in resources and survive the early game to overpower the opponent in the late game.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board with counterspells, removal spells, and disruption while generating card advantage through Yorion and other value-generating cards like Shark Typhoon and Kiora Bests the Sea God. The goal is to outlast the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and eventually overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the control game plan, with a mix of lands and snow permanents to enable spells like Frost Bite and Cinderclasm. The deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. With cards like Blade Historian and Elite Spellbinder providing additional damage output, combined with cards like Jaspera Sentinel and Prosperous Innkeeper to ramp up mana and create more tokens, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence and finish off the opponent as soon as possible. Additionally, the inclusion of removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing helps to clear the way for your creatures to attack freely.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures and pushing for damage early in the game. It utilizes cards like Lovestruck Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Magda, Brazen Outlaw to establish dominance on the battlefield. The Great Henge and Embercleave provide additional firepower, while Esika's Chariot and Edgewall Innkeeper help generate card advantage. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and support the aggressive game plan. Goldspan Dragon serves as a powerful finisher, capable of closing out games quickly if left unanswered.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage through milling and drawing cards. Using a combination of cheap creatures, counter spells, and removal, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with powerful finishers like Into the Story and Agadeem's Awakening. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion enhances the deck's ability to recur key creatures and spells from the graveyard, giving it longevity in longer games. Overall, the deck excels at outlasting opponents and grinding out victories through resource management and control.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gyruda, Doom of Depths as a companion to quickly assemble a powerful combo. By ramping with Wolfwillow Haven and Tangled Florahedron, the deck aims to cheat out big threats like Massacre Wurm and Polukranos, Unchained for explosive plays. Thassa, Deep-Dwelling helps to blink creatures for added value, while cards like Binding the Old Gods provide removal and disruption. The deck also includes Solemn Simulacrum and Prosperous Innkeeper for additional ramp and card advantage, creating a strong and versatile game plan.
